medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 9 months prior to presentation, starting on her mid-back and spreading to the trunk and upper thighs. Initially treated with steroids leading to temporary improvement, but lesions recurred post-treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ulcerative colitis and intestinal biopsy-proven celiac disease (both in remission), systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) meeting 5 of 11 ACR criteria.
medical_history.family_history: Three children with conduction defects but no heart block.
